dt: {bc}a volume forming part of a larger work

et: Middle French or Latin; Middle French, from Latin {it}tomus{/it}, from Greek {it}tomos{/it} section, roll of papyrus, tome, from {it}temnein{/it} to cut; akin to Middle Irish {it}tamnaid{/it} he lops, Polish {it}ciąć{/it} to cut, and perhaps to Latin {it}tondēre{/it} to shear
shortdef: book; especially : a large or scholarly book
a volume forming part of a larger work

dt: island of western Africa in the Gulf of Guinea just north of the Equator {it}population{/it} 180,000
São Tomé is a constituent part of the country of {d_link|São Tomé and Príncipe|Sao Tome and Principe:g}.
town on the northeast coast of São Tomé island that serves as national capital of São Tomé and Príncipe

shortdef: island of western Africa in the Gulf of Guinea just north of the Equator population 180,000
town on the northeast coast of São Tomé island that serves as national capital of São Tomé and Príncipe

dt: country in the Gulf of Guinea in western Africa consisting of the islands of {d_link|São Tomé|Sao Tome:g} and {d_link|Príncipe|Principe Island:g}; capital São Tomé, {it}area{/it} 372 square miles (964 square kilometers), {it}population{/it} 204,500

shortdef: country in the Gulf of Guinea in western Africa consisting of the islands of São Tomé and Príncipe; capital São Tomé, area 372 square miles (964 square kilometers), population 204,500

dt: {bc}something one is hearing for the first time {bc}something one did not previously know

dt.t: "The concert has been canceled." "Well, that's {it}news to me{/it}."

shortdef: something one is hearing for the first time : something one did not previously know
